title: Request for DA Records on Due Process Violations and Informant Use

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Case-Specific Records (Discovery & Prosecution Materials)

Complete case file related to the prosecution of Kayla Orsell in Gloversville City Court including:

All charging documents, warrants, and affidavits

Grand jury transcripts (if applicable)

Brady material (exculpatory evidence, required to be disclosed under Brady v. Maryland)

Giglio material (evidence that impeaches prosecution witnesses, including informants)

Rosario material (witness statements required under NY law)

All evidence logs and chain of custody records for physical evidence

All subpoenas issued in connection with your case

Internal communications between prosecutors regarding this case

Any orders or memos related to sealing or withholding evidence

Pursuant to New York Public Officers Law § 87 and the principles of government transparency, I request:

A complete financial audit of all payments made to confidential informants (CIs) by the District Attorney’s Office over the past five years.


Records of all disbursement logs, receipts, and financial transactions related to CI payments, including:

Payment amounts, dates, and approving officials.

The justification for each payment.

Policies governing the use and compensation of informants.

Internal audits or reviews of CI payment practices.


Records of any disciplinary actions or investigations related to the misuse or improper handling of CI funds.

These records are essential for assessing potential misuse of public funds and ensuring accountability in the use of informants in criminal prosecutions.

Prosecutorial Misconduct & Systemic Due Process Violations

Complaints or disciplinary actions against the prosecutor(s) involved in this case

Internal policies and training materials on prosecutorial conduct

All records of prior cases where the DA’s office was found to have withheld exculpatory evidence

Data on dismissed or overturned convictions due to prosecutorial misconduct

Communications between the DA’s office and the court regarding the case of Kayla Orsell in Gloversville City Courthouse 

Any notes, memos, or orders related to plea bargaining practices

Emails discussing Kayla Orsell’s case between the DA’s office and local law enforcement

Confidential Informants & Witness Handling

All agreements, communications, and payment records related to confidential informants (CIs) involved in Kayla Orsell’s case

Complete criminal history and cooperation agreements for any CIs who offered testimony or information against Kayla Orsell in her prosecution that took place in Gloversville City Court from 04/09/2024 to 01/18/2025

Training manuals and policies on the use of confidential informants

Any past lawsuits or internal complaints related to informant misconduct

Records showing whether informants were permitted to commit crimes while cooperating

Law Enforcement & Police Misconduct

All police reports and notes related to Kayla Orsell’s case

Internal affairs complaints and investigations into arresting officers

Body camera footage, dash cam footage, and 911 call records related to the arrest

Emails between the DA and Gloversville/Johnstown police about this case

List of all lawsuits filed against law enforcement officers involved in this case

Records of any investigations into missing evidence or tampering

Prior Civil Rights Violations & Lawsuits Against the DA’s Office

Complete list of civil rights lawsuits filed against the DA’s office in the past 10 years

All FOIA/FOIL requests previously denied by the DA’s office

Records of any settlements or judgments against the DA’s office for misconduct

Complaints, disciplinary records, and internal reviews of prosecutors in this case

Emails or memos discussing public records requests related to prosecutorial misconduct

Improper Handling of Kayla Orsell’s Legal Proceedings

Records showing why the City Court handled a felony case (jurisdictional issue)

List of cases where jurisdiction was improperly handled in a similar way

All communications between the DA and the presiding judge DiMezza in Kayla Orsell’s case

Records related to the assignment of Kayla Orsell’s attorneys

Memos or internal DA emails regarding denied transcript requests

FOIA/FOIL Non-Compliance & Cover-Ups

List of all FOIL requests submitted about Gloversville/Johnstown law enforcement

Records showing how many of these FOIL requests were ignored or denied

Policies on how the DA’s office handles FOIL requests

Emails or memos about handling public records requests related to misconduct

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kayla Orsell
